result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R Bartelt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond of $100.00 has been applied, leaving a balance of $343.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Releasing Funds - $100.00 to COC

2:06 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to DC and Bail Jumping, with no domestic enhancer, with jail time and court costs and balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to 2015CM200 and count 2 on 2015CM93, strikes the repeater and orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

BJ (count 1-2015CM200)

-10 days county jail, consecutive to count 2.  Huber.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

DC (Count 2-2015CM93)

-30 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant 1 day sentence credit. (2015CM93)

Court adjourned at 2:15 p.m.

Jury trial - 12 person on June 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Court sets for Jury Trial on  June 10, 2016 at 8:15 a.m.
